channel.description: Toby Glenn and Steve Cujo talk to Mixed Martial Artists (MMA Fighters) about everything they do (from training to fighting and what they plan to do next) every sunday around 10:15pm Eastern and we also discuss the latest news. Some of the organizations we talk about are Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), Pride FC, WEC (World Extreme Cagefighting), Elite XC , IFL (International Fight League) and Bodog Fight. Also Tim does fighter interviews and Rhonda covers live events. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

channel.itunes:subtitle: MMA Discussions

item.title: Duke Roufus
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn talks to Duke Roufus who is one of the best trainers in MMA. Duke talks about training Alan Belcher. Duke is a famed kickboxer and trainer who was supposed to have his Mixed Martial Arts debut at Cage Fury Fighting Championships. He is a former Former ISKA, WKA, WAKO & IKF World Heavyweight Champion. Duke goes on and discusses many aspects of training and working with fighters. He will be back in the March 28 in Milwaukee for a Muay Thai bout. He also talks a bit about K1 and problems with that organization. Duke also trains Big Ben Rothwell and discussed his relationship with him.

item.title: Yves Edwards
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn does an interview with Yves Edwards who is about to have a fight on the Elite XC street certified on Showtime. Yves an individual who has had an amazing career with fights in the UFC and Pride FC. He's got wins over big-name Fighters like Hermes Franca and Josh â??the punkâ?? Thompson. Yves talks about his career in Pride and the drug testing that they had in pride and the differences between Pride in the UFC. We then go on to discuss his career and the amazing turnaround that he's done in his career while changing to American top team and refocusing. Yves then talks about the fight with James Edson Berto this Saturday. We discuss his plans for that fight and what he plans to do after that fight. He's coming off two big wins one in Elite XC and one at HDnet fights. It was great to get to talk to him and was a great interview.

item.title: WEC & Elite XC Preview
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn, Steve Cujo, Rhonda, and Tim break down the World Extreme Cagefighting event that is this Wednesday. On that fight card Carlo Prater fights Carlos Condit in the main event. Then Rob McCullough will fight Jamie Varner for the 155 pound title. Miguel Torres will take on Chase Beebe for his 135 pound title. Also on that card we broke down fights with Yoshiro Maeda vs. Charlie Valencia, Hiroyuki Takaya vs. Leonard Garcia, Micah Miller vs. Chance Farrar, Mark Hominick vs. Josh Grispi, Cody Wheeler vs. Del Hawkins, and Damacio Page vs. Scott Jorgensen. Then Toby Glenn and Steve Cujo break down the Elite XC. The main event features Kevin Ferguson vs David Abbott. Then we break down the fights of Kyle Noke vs Scott Smith, Edson Berto vs Yves Edwards, Brett Rogers vs James Thompson, and Antonio Silva vs Ricco Rodriguez.

item.itunes:subtitle: WEC & Elite XC Preview

item.title: Jamie "The Worm" Varner
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Today on a MMA Discussions Radio Toby Glenn is joined by Jamie â??The Wormâ?? Varner. Jamie Varner originally comes from Arizona and trains there. He is fighting in the WEC against Razor Rob McCullough. I discuss with him his fight with Hermes Franca, cutting weight, his training for this fight, and so much more. I also talked to him about something that's really important to me which is MMA in Pennsylvania and we discuss what drives fighters to be high-level athletes in mixed martial arts from Lock Haven University in Pennsylvania and why many of them move away after college. Arizona Combat Sports is the name of the gym that he trains at and he discusses his training partners and how they've helped him prepare for this fight. He mentioned Deer Valley High School Memorial foundation which is helping families that were affected in a busing accident. To gain the full information about the accident and how to donate go to http://www.azcentral.com/news/articles/0109bus0109main.html.

item.title: UFC 81 Post Show Roundtable
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn, Tim, and Steve Cujo discussed UFC 81 breaking point but before that we go on to talk about Cung Le versus Frank Shamrock. This fight sparked a huge debate between Tim and Toby Glenn. Toby picks to Frank Shamrock win the fight. However, Tim picksCung Le to win by knockout. Toby thinks it's absurd that a fighter who's never fought a true 185 pound fighter in its entire history can beat Frank Shamrock. Tim seems to believe that the Phil Baroni fight was a set up and that Frank Shamrock hasn't won a fight since his return to mixed martial arts. That makes sense because Frank Shamrock's first fight back was against Henzo Gracie and he lost that by disqualification. It was a heated debate and in the end neither of us could agree and we made a wager on that battle. We then go on to discuss all the flight on the UFC 81 breaking point fight card including Tim Boetsch vs. David Heath , Chris Lytle vs. Kyle Bradley, Keita Nakamura vs. Rob Emerson, Marvin Eastman vs. Terry Martin, Gleison Tibaua vs. Tyson Griffin, Ricardo Almeida vs. Alan Belcher, Jeremy Horn vs. Nathan Marquardt, Frank Mir vs. Brock Lesnar, Tim Sylvia vs. Antonio Rodrigo â??Minotauroâ?? Nogueira.

item.title: Bill Smallwood & Rules Conversation
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn and Tim start off by talking about the match between Rani Yahya vs Norifumi "Kid" Yamamoto. The stoppage of that fight in Toby's opinion was based on kicks to the back of the head which were illegal in K1 Hero's. Toby and Tim talk to Bill Smallwood the icefighter who is a professional fighter with a 2 and 2 mixed martial arts record. We also spend some time discussing Brock Lesner vs Frank Mir with Bill on the show.

item.title: UFC Fight Night 12 and ShoXC: Elite Challenger Series Review
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: In this episode of MMA Discussions radio Toby Glenn and Steve Cujo go over UFC Fight Night 12. Toby airs his opinion that Josh Burkman did not get a fair decision. This fight card was pretty good but Toby spends some time complaining because he did not do so good on his picks. He also discusses the changes to Drew McFedries stance and more. Then Toby Glenn and Steve Cujo go over the ShoXC Elite challenger event which in Toby's opinion was the best ShoXC event ever. It had a good main event with Philadelphia, PA native Eddie Alvarez taking on a tough Hawaiian in Ross da boos Ebanez. The show even started off with a bang when Kala Kolohe Hose took on Frederic Belleton. Check out my full recap on the show.

item.title: KOTC Lightweight Champ Joe Camacho
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn and Steve Cujo talked with the King of the Cage Lightweight Champion Joe Camacho. He just got a big win over Thomas "The Wildman" Denny at a King of the Cage show. He overwhelmed Denny and really took the fight to him. We talked to Joe about his carrier and what he is doing next. It was a great interview and something motivational to listen to.

item.title: Team Apocalypse and UFC 80:Rapid Fire
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn, Steve Cujo and many of the Team Apocalypse members go on the air and talk about some problems team Apocalypse has had with a fighter nicknamed kino and his team. Some of the people on the show are brandon boggs, charmed -a female fighter and many more. Dallas the manager for Team Apocalypse also comes on to clarify a few things. Then after that we go on to discuss UFC 80 Rapid Fire and go over what happened on that Sunday afternoon of fights.

item.title: Total Cage Combat Live Coverage Part 1
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tonight MMA Discussions Radio has live coverage of Total Cage Combat NEW YEAR'S KNOCKOUT. Rhonda and Shane went out and did live play by play along with Rhonda working hard to get interviews with the fighters. A very interesting night of fights with them working hard t cover the event. The main fights on the card are Artur Rofi vs Chris Buckner for the Featherweight Title. Michael Smith vs John Constantatos for the Light Heavyweight Title. Michael Phillips vs Westwood Donnelly for the Bantamweight Title. Daniel Dove vs Selah Williams for the Middleweight Title.

item.title: Cub Swanson and Brandon Jinnies
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tim, Noah Thomas, and Matt from MMAInsideWeekly.com talks with Cub Swanson who is training up in big bear with Joe Stevenson's camp. Noah gets on the subject of Jen Pulver and to give a little background on Noah's season of the Ultimate Fighter Jens said Noah was a pussy... Tim discusses the elevetain training with Cub and how Cub got into fighting. For people havent Cub he is very talented and could be to much for Jen Pulver. He gets into the WEC and how they are treating the fighters and the lighter weights. Then Tim and Matt from MMAInsideWeekly.com talk to Brandon Jinnies. Brandon discusses how he got into Mixed Martial Arts. He started training in Stockton with Nick Diaz. He talks about his fight carrier and fighters getting used by promoters. His record as an amateur was 21-5. He was training with Rich Clementi for awhile and he discusses fighter pay. Check it out.

item.title: Mike Dolce, TUF Finale, and Steve Mazzagatti
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: First, Noah and Tim talk to Mike Dolch. He is up at team quest north. He is currently fighting for the Portland Wolfpack of the International Fight League and headed up in weight. He has been training with Matt Lindlend, Chael Sonnen and the likes. Mike is working with the team members getting them ready for their fights. Noah starts it off talking about some personal stuff and Mike's got a wife. Then Noah And Tim Preview the upcoming WEC and TUF Finale cards. Lastly Tim, Noah and Matt from MMAInsideWeekly.com talk to Steve Mazzagatti. Steve Mazzagatti is one of the premier referees in Mixed Martial Arts. He is a great guy and it shows in his work with the fire department listen to the interview to find out more.

item.title: Jeff Davis Loco
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: One tonightâ??s episode of MMA Discussions Radio Toby Glenn and Steve Cujo talked to Jeff Davis Loco. In that interview, Jeff talks about his last fight with Micah Goss and many other things. We discussed Jeff's age, which is 45 years old. We discuss his fight record where he has an impressive 11 wins and 3 losses on his record. We also talk about his management team named team renegade and his manager Bryan Hillard. Afterwards, we discussed potential rematch with Micah Goss on December 15 and a potential matchup with friend at the show Noah Thomas in the future. We also go over his day job and what it's like having a son and fighting as a pro fighter. check it out

item.title: Chad Nuzum, Ryan Parker, & UFC78 Recap Part 2
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn and Bobby Friend talk to Chad Nuzum. Chad Nuzum is the agent for the management portion of American Fighter. Tim talks to Ryan Parker about his career as a fighter in Massachusetts, MMA in Mass, Fighters from Mass, Hardcore music and more. Special Thanks to Kevin Grant for setting up the interview. Then Toby Glenn, Matt from MMAInsideWeekly.com, and Steve Cujo discuss UFC78. In this part of the interview we discuss Joe Doerksen Vs. Ed Herman and Ed's progression to being a vicious striker as well as quality grappler. Then we go over Thiago Silva Vs. Houston Alexander and finally the main event of Michael Bisping Vs. Rashad Evans.

item.title: UFC 78 Validation Recap Part 1
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn, Matt from MMAInsideWeekly.com and Steve Cujo discuss UFC 78 Validation. In are discussion we evaluate the UFC's production and how we did in our picks for the fights. In part one of our recap we go over the fights of that fight card. We start with Akihiro Gono Vs. Tamden McCrory a fight were Gono got the victory and Toby was the only one to pick him in the group. Then we go over the Luke Caudillo Vs. Marcus Aurelio fight. Afterwards, we evaluate the Chris Lytle Vs. Thiago Alves where Matt got a gift because in Toby's opinion that fight was stopped early. Then we go over the Jason Reinhardt Vs. Joe Lauzon and we relate the way the fight played out to the interview we did with Jason before the fight. The next fight was Toby's favorite because Frank Edgar did exactly what Toby said he would against Spencer Fisher. Lastly we discuss Ryo Chonan Vs. Karo Parisyan and what is next in both of their carriers.

item.title: StrikeForce Tournament Review
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: There was a four man tournament in StrikeForce last weekend. Trevor Prangley fought against Falaniko Vitale in the first round. That fight was stopped because of a scratch to the eye of Vitale. Jorge Santiago then fought a replacement for Yuki Sasaki. That replacement was Sean Salmon. Santiago got a quick victory. On the show Toby and Matt from MMAInsideWeekly discuss our prefight picks and how the tournament unfolded. Then we talk about Luke Stewart vs. Bryson Kamaka and the Bobby Southworth vs. Anthony Ruiz fights. Afterwards, We go into detail about the Cung Le vs. Sam Morgan fight and the heavyweight title fight of Paul Buentello vs. Alistair Overeem.

item.title: Jeff Adler & Mikey Burnett
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby Glenn and Bobby Friend talk to Jeff Adler of American Fighter/Damage Wear Inc. Jeff gave us an understanding of where he comes from and how he started Damage Wear and American Fighter. We spend quite a bit of time also discussing Rich Franklin who is of course a close friend of Jeff Adler. He talks about starting out with Rich and Rich's part in American Fighter's success. He also talks about a potential tv show featuring Rich that he is in talks with networks about putting on the air. Jeff is a great guy and he explains quite a bit about what it is like being one of the larger MMA sponsors. He also discusses the new management services and other offerings from American Fighter. Then Tim and Noah Thomas interview Mikey Burnett. Mikey talks about teaching fighters and still learning even at his experience level. Mikey always delivers so much incite into the fight game. Noah Thomas also weighs in and shows his knowledge of the sport.

item.title: Lionel Cortes Fund w/ Al Buck, Alex Serdyukov, & Benji Radach
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tim talks to Al "Mr. Big" Buck about the The Lionel Cortes Fund. Lionel Cortes is a man who has always been there for everyone and anyone whether he knew them or not. Lionel is an honorable man who has for nothing helped anyone he could, now he and his 2 beautiful children need help from you!!! He has been in a terrible motorcycle accident and is in critical condition. As of now we are trying to raise money, 1st going to his children to provide the Christmas that he promised, and then going directly to him and/or his family to help them get through this terrible time. They have set up a Lionel Cortes fund through Paypal all proceeds will go directly to Lionel and/or his family if you wish to donate just click on the donate button below on their myspace page and it will redirect you to paypal whick is a secure was to send money!!! just follow instructions if you do not have an account. You can also make checks payable to the Lionel Cortes fund and drop off a check to any commerce bank anything will help. No donation is to little. Anything will be greatly appreciated. thank-you and god bless all of you and keep lionel in your prayers. Go to www.myspace.com/lionelcortesfund to find out the full details. Then Toby and Matt talk with Alex Serdyukov. He was supposed to fight on the No Limit Fighting event in California on a fight card named Brawl For it All. He got nothing for his appearance even after cutting the weight and showing up to the venue. I then talked to him about his future in the WEC and what he thinks about the WEC and Zuffa. Alex has had some amazing fights in the past and I can't wait to see what he does in the future. Tim, Matt, and Noah Thomas interview Benji Radach. Benji will be fighting IFL Grand Prix. He was about to be going to corner Dennis Hallman at StrikeForce.

Then Tim and Mike Varner talk about his fight background, the state of Mixed Martial Arts in Massachusetts, and FullForce Productions.

item.description: Tim and Matt talk to Noah Inhofer who is a fighter who trained in his basement and now trains with Miletich in Iowa. He fought Jesse Forbes on the Ultimate Fighter season three. Took his first fight in a tournament and ended up doing well you'll have to here the full story or Noah's fighting carrier. I pick Paul and Matt picks Overeem find out why on the show.

item.description: Toby Glenn, Steve 'Cujo', and Matt from MMAInsideWeekly.com break down the EliteXC: Renegade fight card. We start by discussing Yves Edwards vs Nick Gonzalez. All of us picked Nick Diaz over K.J. Noons...

item.title: Vanguards Of Comics & Marcus "The Wrecking Ball" Hicks
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: On this episode of MMA discussions radio Tim talks with Charles Underhill of Vanguards Of Comics. He discusses the process of making comic books and what his company has been doing. He talks about doing comics for fighters and sponsoring them. He does so many different fighters and character representations of them. Then Toby joins Tim to talk to Marcus "The Wrecking Ball" Hicks. He is a WEC fighter with with a perfect record of 6-0. He will be potentially fighting Jamie Varner for the number one contenders spot at 155 pounds. He has been in many grappling tournaments and done very well. He also wins quite a few fights in very short order.

item.title: Jason Reinhardt, MMAInsideWeekly, & David Sachs
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby and Matt talked to Jason Reinhardt who is a fighter with a record of18 - 0. He will be stepping up from being a 135 pound and 145 pound champion to fight in the UFC. He will be fighting Joe Lauzon at UFC 78 in New Jersy on November 17. We talked to him about everything from his past injories to his journey to the UFC. He is vary talented and this should be a good fight. Then I talk to Matt about his website MMA Inside Weekly and the content partnership that we have planned. For people who go to MMADiscussions.com the news from MMA Inside Weekly will be syndicated and shown on the main page. Also expect to here Matt on the radio show more often. Then Tim and Toby Glenn talk to David Sachs from the Pittsburgh Fight Club. We talk to him about ring of combat and his record of 3 - 1. Also we talked to David about many things related to Mixed Martial Arts in Pennsylvania. Two things mentioned were mixed events in Pa can not only feature amateur fights and 5 fights are going to be recommended to turn professional in Pa.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 42 - Mikey Burnett
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby talks with Mikey "The Eastside Assassin" Burnett. We discuss much about his life and the battles he has had in and out of the cage. We go over what has happened to Renato "Babalu" Sobral and the way Dana White deals with some of his fighters. Mikey is also battling with sleep apnea and is still training fighters. Mikey is always great to talk to because he will share his true opinions on subjects. He also discusses Matt Serra's win against GSP. He is a true warrior.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 41 - Mike Ciesnolevicz
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Toby talks with Mike Ciesnolevicz about the silverbacks dominance in the IFL. We also discuss many aspects of the IFL both there major successes and flaws. Then we go on and discuss the finals and how that has shaped up for them and there match up with Henzo's Pitbulls. Mike will be fighting Andre Gusmao which is a fight that he will be prepared for this time. We discuss how he matches up with Andre and what he took from there first fight. We go on to talk about the fighters that recently left the Miletich camp namely Robie Lawler and Matt Hughes. Mike is a great guy and a great interview.

item.description: John Doyle is an impressive fighter with a 4 - 1 record with one no contest. He has been featured by beating his opponent which is featured on Tapout. His two fights with Brendan Barrett were very impressive and he is a great fight from Pennsylvania. He was born in New Jersey and has many fights there.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 25 - Chris Botelho
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tonight Toby Glenn talks with Professional Mixed Martial Arts fighter Chris Botelho about his carrier and fighting. Chris is a 3-2 fighter with one no contest. His last fight was supposed to be Jason Von Flue in the main event of the Palace Fighting Championship. Jason had to pull out due to his suspension from losing a previous fight at Strikeforce. However, Chris fought Josh McCartney and got a hard fought but definitive decision. He is an impressive up and coming fighter who will be fighting for the PFC 170 championship in his next fight for them. He also has a fight coming up in September. He explained in the interview his plans for the future and what the no contest was from in a previous fight.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 21 - "CRAZY" Tim Credeur, Joe Camacho
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tonight Toby Glenn and Tim got to speak with "CRAZY" Tim Credeur about fighting in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. He runs a gym called Gladiators Academy. He trains with Alan Belcher and Rich Clementi. He is 7-2 officially but has had quite a few fights. He is a military personal who has had many fights over the years. He will be fighting September 1st at the IXFA, INTERNATIONAL EXTREME FIGHT ASSOCIATION, show vs Brandon McDowell. Afterwards, We talked with Joe Camacho. He fought in the first Shooto event here in North Amarica. He was brought in to fight Akiyo "Wicky" Nishiura. He ended up wining the fight by all accounts and even had his hand raised at the end of the fight. Afterwards, The score cards were looked at and his win was striped and made into a draw after "Judo" Gene Lebell's cards were examined and a point was not taken from Joe. However, Gene said that he gave all the rounds to Joe Camacho which would make the final scoring 29-27.
item.itunes:author: tobyglenn

item.description: Mike Thomas Brown is a professional fighter that has fought all over the world and has amassed a record of 16 - 4. His latest fight was a win over Yves Edwards in Bodog fight. He has fought some of the best 155 and 145 pound fighters. Some of the fights that Tim and Toby Glenn discuss with him are his fights with Hermes Franca, Mark Hominick, Genki Sudo, and Joe Lauzon. We also discuss his training and what he would like to do next.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 11 - Jamie Varner
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: On tonights show Toby and Tim talked with Jamie Varner. He was formally know as the worm and he has two UFC fights and now an impressive victory in the WEC. He fought Sherron Leggett and got an easy victory. He also during the fight shot for a single leg and was in deep and picked hi opponent up in a firemens carry when he dropped the opponent in what could only be described as a pro-wrestling death valley driver. He then went on to pick up a TKO from strikes. In the UFC he fought Jason Gilliam and got a quick rear naked choke victory. His first UFC fight was against Hermes Franca and he lost in the 3rd round by armbar. He went on to discuss his training and what he has coming up next.

item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Lana Lethal Stefanac is a light heavyweight female fighter with a mixed martial arts record of 3 and 0. She is a purple belt juijitsu specialist that also has good stand up skills and defence. All of her three fights have ended in the first round with the longest one lasting less than three minutes. She has wins over female fighters with very good stand up skills. Her latest win was over the then 4-0 fighter Teyvia Reid and she also has wins over Stacy Piper Ford and Martha Salazar. All of her wins were by submission the last two being by way of arm bar. She will be fighting on Art of War 3 Saturday September 1 against Franita Gathings. To find out more about lana go to http://www.myspace.com/lethallana or http://www.lethallana.com/.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 9 - LC Davis & Bobby Friend
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: LC Davis is a fighter from the Miletich FIghting systems who has a undefeated record of 8-0 according to sherdog. He has two IFL victories. His first one was at IFL - Chicago and his next was at IFL - 2007 Semifinals. In those fights he beat Jay Estrada and Conor Heun. He is a natural 145 pounder but even at 155 he is an impressive fighter. Then, Bobby Friend comes back on the show and we talk about his win at SM Fights. He fought Joey Hoffman and got a quick first round victory. After the fight Joey apologized and it sounds like the bad blood is over.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 8 - James Lee
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: James Lee is an impressive MMA fighter with a win on Pride 33 and the King of the Cage Light-Heavyweight Champion. He has quite a bit of experience in MMA. He fought Travis Wiuff in the Pride 33 show and his last fight was for his King of the Cage championship Aungla Sang. He has dominated almost all of his opponents with first round victories. He has a record of 24-2 however, his sherdog record does not show his Australian King Of The Cage fights.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 7 - Mike Cook
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: On this show Tim and Toby Glenn talk with Mike Cook (4-1) heavyweight fighter. He is an up and coming fighter with his last win at Palace Fighting Championship 3: Step Up. In that fight he defeated Rolando Torres in just 12 seconds by knock out. He also got a win over Scott Wimmer at the previous PFC event. Before that, in his third pro fight he faced Daniel Puder and took that fight into the second round before being rear naked choked. He is fighting warpath in October. To find out more about Mike Cook go to his myspace page at http://www.myspace.com/1biganimal.

item.title: Season 3 - Episode 6 - Lethal Lee Gibson
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tim and Toby sat down with Lethal Lee Gibson to discuss his last two fights. He fought Talon Hoffman at an IFO fight and defeated him by TKO by pounding him out with strikes. Then he fought Muhsin Corbbrey and was robbed in a decision after the fight went the full 15 minutes. The Muhsin Corbbrey fight was close but watching the ShoXC fight makes it difficult to see how two judges scored the fight 30-27.

item.title: EPISODE35 - UFC 73 (explicit)
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Tim and Toby Glenn discuss UFC 73 and we even go back in time and talk about the StrikeForce-Elite XC show. UFC 73 Fights Heavyweight bout: Nogueira defeated Herring by unanimous decision after three rounds. Lightweight championship bout: Sherk defeated Franca by unanimous decision after five rounds. Light heavyweight bout: Evans and Ortiz fought to an unanimous draw after three rounds. Middleweight championship bout: Silva defeats Marquardt by technical knockout at 4:54 of the first round. Lightweight bout: Kenny Florian defeats Robinson by TKO due to strikes at 4:30 of the first round. Also discussed is the Stewart vs Jason Von Flue fight and the main card fights of Strikeforce.

item.title: EPISODE31 - Bobby Friend joins the show
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: We discussed the Cage Brawl card promoted by Sam Abraham that happened June 9,2007. A general synopsis of the conversation: Bobby did not get to fight on that show. It was said that he did not make weight but he had a verbal agreement with Rodney Carter (the guy he was fighting) that the fight was going to happen even though the Ohio representative had not gotten there to weigh them. The representative was supposed to show up at 3:00pm (The day of the fights!!) and was very late for the weigh ins. Bobby had already gone back to his room to rehydrate for the fight. The promoter, Sam, did not contact him to tell him that he had to make weight when the representative got there. When Bobby was told it was to close to 6:00pm and there was no way for him to make weight. The fight card went on and there were many problems. Also, one of the fighters on the card who goes by Tha Super 1 had been dragging Bobby's name through the mud. He had also refused blood tests from the Commission and was not allowed to fight. Allan Stamp was also on the call and he corroborated the story and explained in more detail some of the things that occurred. He explained how the promoter had only bought 8 pairs of gloves and had 17 fights scheduled for the card. A suspicious thing was that Sam A was a manager of Rodney C. Bobby and Allen were in agreement that his name was put on the card to sell tickets. To find out more about the guests: myspace.com/bobby_mma_fighter and to myspace.com/stryker59.

item.title: EPISODES - The life of Jeremy Williams
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: today I (toby glenn) an doing a special episode with Ryan Bengard a friend of the now deceased Jeremy Williams (of the IFL). Jeremy had the nickname the spider and was involved with Apex Jiujitsu. Jeremy was a familyman and left behind a wife, daughter, and another (daughter) on the way. To donate to the Williams family trust fund, log on to PayPal and click send money to childrentrust@aol.com. He competed as a middleweight fighter for the IFLs southern California Condors, and was undefeated in two bouts in the IFL.

item.title: EPISODE18 - Steve Blackman joins the show
item.author: tobyglenn@gmail.com
item.description: Steve Blackman joins MMA Jumpnow on Sunday, May 6 at 2:00 pm eastern to talk about MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) and his gym in Harrisburg, PA. Steve Blackman is a Martial Artist from Pennsylvania and a former professional wrestler who most notably worked for the World Wrestling Federation (now WWE) as "The Lethal Weapon" Steve Blackman. There is a major announcement that has been made by the PA State Athletic Commission that we will discuss. His gym was opened in July 2006 and is named Steve Blackman's Fighting Systems. He's gym features MMA classes as well as professional wrestling training. The website for his gym is www.harrisburg-mma.com . Music provided by the The Pistol Whipper Snappers there profile is at http://tinyurl.com/ypu5r4 or myspace.com/pistolwhippersnappers.
